meanings.sent1: After his term ended, they are reappointing him as the team captain.
meanings.sent2: The company is reappointing the manager for another year.
meanings.sent3: The mayor kept reappointing the same person, causing some to joke about a lack of options.
meanings.sent4: Reappointing the head chef was like bringing back the star player to the team.
meanings.sent5: The board's decision to reappoint the CEO was met with mixed reactions.

meanings.sent1: The reappointing of the committee members was a lengthy process.
meanings.sent2: She was excited about her reappointing to the board of directors.
meanings.sent3: The reappointing of the school principal led to a celebration among the students.
meanings.sent4: The reappointing of the judge brought stability to the court.
meanings.sent5: His reappointing to the position came as a surprise to many.
